info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 21 at 3:11AM MST until December 21 at 11:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, A period of moderate to heavy snow and gusty north winds early this morning in the Bridger, Elkhorn and Boulder Mountains with snow ending from north to south by 9 AM. Additional snow accumulations up to two inches. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 60 below zero. * WHERE...Big Belt, Bridger and Castle Mountains, Elkhorn and Boulder Mountains, Helena Valley and Upper Blackfoot and MacDonald Pass. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 11 AM MST this morning. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 AM this morning to 6 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow can significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning commutes. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Near record cold daytime maximum and overnight minimum temperatures are likely today through Thursday. Minimum temperatures of 30 below to 40 below zero expected tonight with isolated colder readings possible.
